scenarioDescription:
The HD 96127 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 96127 is a star with 10.94 times the mass of the Sun, and 51.1 times its radius. It is located 1916.69 light years away from the solar system.

HD 96127 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 96127 system


HD 96127 b

HD 96127 b was discovered by the McDonald Observatory observatory, in 2012-01, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 1.42 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 96127 b is 6665.280 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 96127 b is 12.100 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 96127 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 96127, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the McDonald Observatory.
name: HD 96127 - System With 1 Exoplanet
